general.name: Leonie Magnusson
general.summary: I am a graphic designer and illustraitor with an interest for boardgames, compelling stories and programming. I am based in Gothenburg, Sweden, where me and my business partner Sam Gullman run our small publishing company Purple Lantern Games. I enjoy a good cup of tea, together with a nice audio book and my pen ready to bring ideas to life.

work.name: Purple Lantern Games
work.summary: Together with my business partner, Sam Gullman, I developed our first board game, The Presence, and successfully prepared for a global crowdfunding campaign. 2023 we officially founded our small publishing company Purple Lantern Games.

work.name: Art Faculty, University of Gothenburg
work.summary:
I was the sole developer responsible for developing and maintaining the WordPress site PARSE-journal (www.parsejournal.com) during a temporary contract. I set up a new workflow with the product owner, utilizing GitHub Issues as an issue handling system with a board to effectively track our work. My tasks included modifying layouts, fixing bugs, implementing new features, and cleaning up the codebase. I created a CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions for automatic deployment of the website upon changes and developed comprehensive documentation for setting up the workspace environment and for routine tasks. The environment ran locally in a Docker container, and I worked with PHP, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. Additionally, I implemented code linting to ensure code quality.

What I particularly enjoyed about this role was acting as a detective to solve various challenges, as much of the work was new to me and I didnâ€™t have colleagues to turn to for assistance. I researched solutions online and utilized ChatGPT to help me navigate and resolve issues. It was rewarding to see how I could leverage both my design skills and my logical problem-solving abilities to tackle programming tasks and fix bugs.

work.name: KonstkÃ¥ren, University of Gothenburg
work.summary: As the elected Chairperson of the Art Students of Gothenburg University Union, I dedicated a year to leading the union with passion and purpose. My role encompassed managing the organisational needs of the union, representing the students at the university, within the City of Gothenburg, and even on a national stage. I actively engaged in student politics, attending numerous meetings to advocate for the students. Beyond representation, I contributed creatively by designing graphic and social media content and helped organise large-scale student events such as the beloved art school Christmas market, that fostered community and collaboration.

work.name: Albert
work.summary: During my internship at Albert, I developed a DIY game-making toy for children called the Analog Game Engine. This tool allows children aged 4 to 6 to create and play their own video games using paper, coloured pencils, and stickers.

work.name: AranÃ¤sgymnasiet and Elof LindÃ¤lvs Gymnasium
work.summary: I taught two German classes: an introductory level and an intermediate level for high school students. I was recommended for this position and held it until a certified German teacher was employed. I enjoyed sharing my native language with the students while also introducing them to German culture. Together, we engaged in various exercises, and due to the Covid-19 pandemic, many classes were conducted online. This presented unique challenges, which I successfully navigated.

work.name: Strawbees
work.summary: During my 5-month internship at the toy company Strawbees, I was involved in a variety of tasks. I worked on their Black Friday campaign, created social media content, wrote instruction books for their products, and developed a prototype for a magazine.

education.institution: Burg Giebichenstein University of Art and Design
education.studyType: B.A. Design of Playing and Learning (Industrial Design)

education.area:
I pursued additional courses to explore my interest in software development and user research. These courses included:

- Requirements and User Experience
- Mathematical Foundations for Software Engineering
- Object-Oriented Programming

education.institution: University of Gothenburg, UmeÃ¥ University, Dalarna University
education.area: I am taking addition courses to get my licence as a german teacher in Sweden.
